resource.chars:
ganglion, of a brownish colour by 
reflected light - From its extremities 
commissural branches pass round 
the mouth while other cords are distributed 
to the arms, the superior & inferior 
pallial lobes & to the so-called 
hearts - The nerves are marked 
by fine & distinct longitudinal 
striations & can be traced to the 
margins of the pallial lobes where 
they become lost among the muscular 
fibres of the free edges of the mantle
